content:
As an AI language model, I don't have access to current, up-to-date information on Reebok's waste reduction efforts or their impact on the environment. However, companies typically measure and report on their waste reduction efforts by tracking metrics such as the amount of waste generated, the percentage of waste that is recycled or reused, and the amount of waste that is diverted from landfills.

By doing so, they can determine the effectiveness of their waste reduction strategies and identify areas for improvement. In some cases, companies may even hire third-party auditors to verify their waste management and reduction practices and report on their progress.

Companies like Reebok may also measure the environmental impact of their waste reduction efforts by looking at factors such as the amount of greenhouse gas emissions avoided through recycling or the reduction in water usage and pollution associated with closed-loop production systems.

Overall, while specific data on Reebok's waste reduction efforts and the impact on the environment may not be publicly available, their commitment to responsible waste management and sustainable manufacturing practices is commendable and can make a significant difference in reducing the environmental impact of their operations.
